CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 16, 1951, pg. 9 reads: "Those Who Received Degrees At Pitt - Rain...change in plans for a commencement on the ..Pittsburgh lawn here Wednesday morning. As...receiving degrees from Pitt undergraduate...given them at ceremonies at 10:30 A.M. in...Degrees from graduate schools at Pitt were...ceremony later the same day at 2:30 P.M. in ...The Courier cameraman was able to snap the persons shown above as they prepared to receive their degrees in time for this week's deadline.  There'll be more pictures of degree winners, both from the undergraduate school and the graduate school of Pitt, as well as Carnegie Institute of Technology's graduates printed in next week's edition of the Courier.  Duquesne University's graduates were printed last week....Center: Second Lieut. Lamar Dukes was commissioned as a chemical engineer.  He was awarded his commission at the commencement although he does not graduate until next year... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of University of Pittsburgh graduate Second Lieut. Lamar Dukes, posed in Syria Mosque, Oakland
